document.docAuthor: Pádua, Diego G., Oliveira, Marcio L., Onody, Helena C., Sobczak, Jober F., Sääksjärvi, Ilari E. & Gómez, Isrrael C.
document.docTitle: Hymenoepimecis Pádua, Oliveira, Onody, Sobczak, Sääksjärvi & Gómez, 2015, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: The Brazilian Amazonian species of Hymenoepimecis Viereck, 1912 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Brazilian Amazonian species of Hymenoepimecis Viereck, 1912 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Brazilian Amazonian species of
Hymenoepimecis

subSubSection.paragraph:
[The males of
H. amazonensis
sp. n.
,
H. bicolor
,
H. heteropus
,
H. kleini
sp. n.
and
H. neotropica
are unknown].

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Female
; ovipositor projecting conspicuously beyond apex of metasoma........................................... 2

4 Tarsal claw with a flat preapical tooth, apex of claw 3.0 × the lenght of the tooth (
Fig. 12
).................
H. kleini
sp. n.

- Tarsal claw with short basal lobe vertically, slightly quadrangular, apex of claw clearly overtaking the lobe (
Fig. 13
)..........................................................................................
H. amazonensis
sp. n.

- Metasoma with tergites I–V oranges, tergites VI+ blacks (
Fig. 10
); ovipositor 1.2–1.3 × as long as hind tibia
H. ribeiroi
sp. n.

9 Pronotum black (
Fig. 16
); tarsal claw narrow elongated vertically, with apex slightly overtaking the lobe (
Fig. 20
)...............................................................................................
H. duckensis
sp. n.

11 Fore wing hyaline (
Fig. 9
); hind leg orange, with apex of femur, tibia and tarsus blacks (
Fig. 11
).......
H. manauara
sp. n.

12 Pronotum black (
Fig. 16
); hind leg black, with base of coxa orange (
Fig. 10
)........................
H. duckensis
sp. n.

- Pronotum orange; hind leg orange, with tibia and tarsus blacks (
Fig. 17
).............................
H. ribeiroi
sp. n.
